alert.note: Alert for Anson; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 7:54AM EST until January 11 at 8:10PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Rocky River Near Norwood affecting Stanly and Anson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Rocky River near Norwood. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Action Stage. The river begins to overflow its banks in some areas upstream of the gage site. At 20.0 feet, Minor flood stage. There is significant overflow into adjacent pasture and lowlands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 20.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 5.9 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Rocky River Norwood 20.0 20.5 Thu 7 am EST 9.9 7.3 6.7 6.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 800 PM EST.
